Class Filter4Translator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Filter
      • Filter4Translator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Filter4Translator
extends Filter
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class responsible for converting The DNA sequences from Frame Builder into their corresponding amino acids
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Constructor Detail

      • Filter4Translator

        public Filter4Translator(Buffer inputBufferLocation,
                         Buffer outputBufferLocation)
        Class constructor, responsible for calling this class's parent class's constructor as well as defining aminoAcids, noFirstAminoAcids, and noSecondAminoAcids.
        Parameters:
        inputBufferLocation - object reference to the buffer that handles inputs
        outputBufferLocation - object reference to the buffer that handles outputs

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is responsible for pulling all information from the Buffer. It stops doing this when it reaches the stopping value (defined in the Filter class). Each time it pulls a String from the buffer it passes it to the sortInputs() method so that it can sort whether an input belongs to the original DNA sequence, the DNA sequence without the first base, or the sequence without the first or second base.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sortInputs

        public void sortInputs(java.lang.String inputToSort)
        Runs through each character from each string pulled from the buffer. Based on each strings "prefix" (or first value) it will determine whether it belongs to the original DNA sequence, the DNA sequence without the first base, or the sequence without the first or second base. From here it will pass the String to the individualString() method. Finally it will pass the new String value, containing only the DNA sequence, to the findAminoAcids() method. It then puts the string of aminoAcids into the buffer with its corresponding prefix and partialStop.
        Parameters:
        inputToSort - String that will be sorted and converted from the buffer

      • individualString

        public java.lang.String individualString(int currentLocation,
                                         java.lang.String inputToSort)
        Takes in a string containing a "prefix" and "partialStop" and returns only the DNA sequence
        Parameters:
        currentLocation - integer showing where to start reading the input String from (so that it does not read the same sequence more than once)
        inputToSort - String it will extract the DNA sequence from
        Returns:
        String containing only the relevant DNA sequence

      • findAminoAcids

        public java.lang.String findAminoAcids(java.lang.String rnaToAmino)
        Used to find the amino acids from each set of 3 RNA sequences
        Parameters:
        rnaToAmino - RNA sequence from amino acid
        Returns:
        String containing the amino acids derived from the RNA sequence

      • printAminoAcids

        public static void printAminoAcids()
        After all threads are executed method is called to print each inputs corresponding amino acids
